radiographic_examinations.findings: The examination shows several subcentimeter hypodense lesions in the liver likely representing cysts or hemangiomas. The pancreas, spleen, adrenal glands, and kidneys are normal. There is wall thickening in the terminal ileum, draping over a 5.5 x 2.1 cm fluid collection in the right lower quadrant, consistent with phlegmonous change. The appendix is not visualized separate from this collection. No evidence of intrahepatic or extrahepatic biliary dilatation. No free fluid in the pelvis. The prostate gland is enlarged measuring 5.6 x 3.5 cm.
